content: Yes, the writers of The Sopranos did meet with real-life law enforcement officials and people involved in organized crime to get inspiration for the show's portrayal. The show's creator, David Chase, has stated in interviews that he did extensive research to accurately depict the world of the Mafia, and he conducted interviews with former FBI agents and members of organized crime to get a sense of how these groups operated. Some of these interviews were conducted in person, while others were done over the phone. Additionally, the show's writers consulted with experts in fields like psychology and addiction to accurately depict the mental health struggles and substance abuse issues that many of the characters face throughout the series. Overall, the writers of The Sopranos worked hard to create a realistic portrayal of organized crime and law enforcement that drew on both real-life cases and expert opinions.
